title: Pentagon admits killing a shepherd with a Hellfire missile in Syria in botched drone strike after mistaking him for a senior Al Qaeda leader
message:
A botched U.S. drone strike in Syria killed a shepherd last year after he was mistakenly identified as a senior Al Qaeda operative.
The Pentagon has admitted a civilian and not a terrorist leader was slain on May 3, 2023 after an internal Central Command (CENTCOM) investigation.
The victim has since been 56-year-old father-of-10 Lufti Hasan Masto, who was killed while he was tending to his sheep.
A MQ-9 predator drone was tracking his movements in fields around his home in the rural town of Qorqanya when a Hellfire missile was fired in his direction.
CENTCOM 'determined U.S. forces misidentified the intended Al Qaeda target and that a civilian, Mr. Lufti Hasan Masto (Masto), was struck and killed instead'.
event_breakdown:
- Botched U.S. drone strike in Syria
- Shepherd mistakenly identified as senior Al Qaeda operative
- Pentagon admits civilian, not terrorist, was slain
- Victim identified as 56-year-old father-of-10 Lufti Hasan Masto
- MQ-9 predator drone tracking movements in fields
- Hellfire missile fired in victim's direction
- CENTCOM investigation determines misidentification of target
- Civilian Mr. Lufti Hasan Masto struck and killed

title: 9 of Ukraine deadliest strikes that killed scores of Russians with a single blow US HIMARS and ATACMS take a toll
message:
Some Ukrainian strikes have killed scores of Russian troops with a single blow.
The UK Defense Ministry said on April 27, 2024, that it estimated 450,000 Russian troops had been killed or wounded since the start of the conflict.
The attack killed more than 100 Russian soldiers in one fell swoop, according to OSINT and military analysts.
Russians killed while training on Dzharylhach islandFootage uploaded by Ukraine of a HIMARS strike on a sandbar.
An unnamed Ukrainian official told the Kyiv Post that it was a "funny situation" because the Russian soldiers had made themselves sitting ducks.
event_breakdown:
- Ukrainian strikes killed scores of Russian troops
- UK Defense Ministry estimated 450,000 Russian troops killed or wounded
- Attack killed more than 100 Russian soldiers
- Russians killed while training on Dzharylhach island
- Footage uploaded by Ukraine of a HIMARS strike on a sandbar

title: US Drone Strike Killed Middle - Aged Shepherd Instead Of Al - Qaeda Terrorist Leader , Probe Finds
message:
A 2023 drone strike originally believed to have killed a top leader of the radical Islamic terrorist group al-Qaeda instead killed a Syrian shepherd, a U.S. Central Command (CENTCOM) assessment revealed Thursday.
An investigation “determined U.S. forces misidentified the intended Al Qaeda target and that a civilian” had been killed, CENTCOM announced.
The investigation involved 10 senior service members and civilian employees who were not directly involved with the strike.
Central Command acknowledges and regrets the civilian harm that resulted from the airstrike,” the press release reads.
“We take all reports of civilian harm caused by U.S. military operations seriously and continue to employ thorough and deliberate targeting and strike processes to minimize civilian harm.
event_breakdown: null

title: Israeli precision - guided munition likely killed group of children playing foosball in Gaza , weapons experts say - LocalNews8 . com
message:
“My soul is gone.”In the two weeks since the attack, the Israeli military’s statements have shifted, but it has not taken responsibility for the strike that ultimately killed Shahed and 10 other children.
An analysis of the site of the attack, documented by a freelance journalist working for CNN in Gaza, paints a very different picture of Israeli military responsibility.
Cobb-Smith said he believed there was “no question” that an Israeli munition was used in the attack, saying Palestinian militants “do not have anything with this amount of sophistication” in their arsenal.
Israeli military’s shifting responseCNN has pressed the Israeli military for details about the strike, which took place on April 16 at about 3:40 p.m., according to video evidence.
The Israeli military declined to provide any additional evidence to back up its claims.

title: U . S . Central Command finds 2023 U . S . airstrike in Syria killed civilian , not terrorist
message:
U.S. Central Command said Thursday an investigation found that a civilian was killed instead of an Al Qaeda terrorist leader in a May 2023 U.S. strike in Syria.
File Photo by Bonnie Cash/UPIMay 2 (UPI) -- U.S. Central Command said Thursday that a May 3, 2023, airstrike in Syria targeting a senior Al Qaeda leader instead killed civilian Lufti Hasan Masto.
"U.S. Central Command acknowledges and regrets the civilian harm that resulted from the airstrike," Centcom's statement said.
"We take all reports of civilian harm caused by U.S. military operations seriously and continue to employ thorough and deliberate targeting and strike processes to minimize civilian harm."
The strike investigation, conducted by Army Brigadier General John P. Cogbill, wrapped up Nov. 15, 2023.
event_breakdown:
- May 3, 2023: U.S. airstrike in Syria targets senior Al Qaeda leader but kills civilian Lufti Hasan Masto instead.
- U.S. Central Command acknowledges civilian harm and regrets the outcome of the airstrike.
- Investigation led by Army Brigadier General John P. Cogbill concludes on November 15, 2023.

title: U . S . Central Command finds 2023 U . S . airstrike in Syria killed civilian , not terrorist
message:
U.S. Central Command said Thursday an investigation found that a civilian was killed instead of an Al Qaeda terrorist leader in a May 2023 U.S. strike in Syria.
CENTCOM said it is fully engaged in implementing Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin's (pictured) Civilian Harm Mitigation and Response Action Plan to minimize civilian harm in future strikes.
File Photo by Bonnie Cash/UPI | License PhotoMay 2 (UPI) -- U.S. Central Command said Thursday that a May 3, 2023, airstrike in Syria targeting a senior Al Qaeda leader instead killed civilian Lufti Hasan Masto.
"U.S. Central Command acknowledges and regrets the civilian harm that resulted from the airstrike," Centcom's statement said.
"We take all reports of civilian harm caused by U.S. military operations seriously and continue to employ thorough and deliberate targeting and strike processes to minimize civilian harm."
event_breakdown: - May 3, 2023: U.S. airstrike in Syria targeting an Al Qaeda leader results in the killing of civilian Lufti Hasan Masto

title: U . S . military concludes airstrike in Syria last May killed a civilian , not a terrorist
message:
Almost a year later, the U.S. military has concluded that an airstrike last May in northwestern Syria killed a civilian, instead of a senior al Qaeda leader, as it initially claimed.
Then, reports quickly surfaced that the strike had killed a civilian, not a terrorist.
In a tweet on May 3, the same day as the strike, a group known as "The White Helmets" who work as first responders in Syria identified Masto as the civilian killed.
The White Helmets said Masto was grazing sheep when the strike killed him and several of the sheep.
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin issued a Civilian Harm Mitigation and Response Action Plan to limit civilian casualties in U.S. military operations after a series of media reports revealed operations in Syria, Iraq, and Afghanistan had killed more civilians than initially reported.
event_breakdown:
1. Airstrike in northwestern Syria initially claimed to have killed a senior al Qaeda leader, later revealed to have killed a civilian.
2. Reports emerged indicating that the airstrike had targeted and killed a civilian rather than a terrorist.
3. "The White Helmets" identified Masto as the civilian killed in the strike while he was grazing sheep.
4. The White Helmets reported that several of the sheep were also killed in the airstrike.
5. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin issued a Civilian Harm Mitigation and Response Action Plan following media reports revealing higher civilian casualties in U.S. military operations in Syria, Iraq, and Afghanistan.

title: 2 Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike that killed civilians
message:
2 Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike that killed civiliansBy VOA News May 02, 2024Two Nigerian military officers will face a court martial over a December drone strike that killed at least 85 civilians, the Defense Headquarters said on Thursday.
The Nigerian military acknowledged the drone accidentally struck a village in northwest Kaduna State, killing residents as they celebrated a Muslim festival.
The military depends on aerial assaults to combat Islamic militants in the northeast and armed kidnapping gangs in the northwest.
"The military has conducted a painstaking investigation into the incident and has initiated disciplinary action against those culpable," he said.
The United Nations human rights office said the drone strike was the latest of at least four airstrikes since 2017 that caused significant civilian fatalities.
event_breakdown:
- Two Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike in northwest Kaduna State.
- Drone strike kills at least 85 civilians in northwest Kaduna State village during Muslim festival celebration.
- Nigerian military acknowledges drone strike accident and initiates disciplinary action.
- Military depends on aerial assaults to combat Islamic militants in northeast and armed kidnapping gangs in northwest.
- United Nations human rights office reports drone strike as latest of at least four airstrikes since 2017 causing significant civilian fatalities.

title: US airstrike targeting al - Qaida leader in Syria killed a farmer , American military says
message:
A US airstrike in Syria in May 2023 that was targeting an al-Qaida leader killed an innocent civilian instead, US Central Command said Thursday, confirming early reports from residents and family members shortly after the attack.
US Central Command said an investigation into the May 3 strike concluded that US forces misidentified the intended al-Qaida target "and that a civilian, Mr. Lufti Hasan Masto, was struck and killed."
Central Command said the investigation into the strike was completed last November — but it wasn't released publicly until Thursday.
In a statement, Central Command said much of the investigation and findings are classified but acknowledged it revealed "several issues that could be improved."
The US also continues to target al-Qaida and Islamic State leaders in Syria, including the 2017 airstrike that killed Abu al-Kheir al-Masri, a former aide to Osama bin Laden and al-Qaida's second in command in Syria.
event_breakdown:
-  A US airstrike in Syria in May 2023 killed an innocent civilian instead of the intended al-Qaida leader
-  US Central Command confirms the civilian casualty in the May 3 strike
-  Central Command's investigation into the strike was completed in November but was only released publicly on Thursday
-  Central Command's statement acknowledged the need for improvements based on the investigation findings
-  The US continues to target al-Qaida and Islamic State leaders in Syria, citing the 2017 airstrike that killed Abu al-Kheir al-Masri

title: Explosion at DRC displaced person camp kills at least 9
message:
Local officials and media reports in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo say at least nine people – most of them children – were killed Friday following an explosion or explosions at displaced persons camp in the eastern city of Goma.
From his X social media account, DRC journalist Daniel Michombero reported an explosion at the Mugunga displaced persons camp in Goma.
Witnesses and local officials reported seeing at least nine bodies at the scene and at least 20 wounded.
A local hospital official told the French news agency AFP the facility had received 32 wounded and four bodies.
In a statement on his official X account, DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blamed the Rwandan army and its “terrorist auxiliaries” the M23 rebels for the attack.
event_breakdown:
- Explosion at the Mugunga displaced persons camp in Goma reported by DRC journalist Daniel Michombero
- At least nine people killed, mostly children, in explosion or explosions at displaced persons camp in Goma
- Witnesses and local officials report at least nine bodies and 20 wounded at the scene
- Local hospital received 32 wounded and four bodies from the incident
- DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blames Rwandan army and M23 rebels for the attack

title: Armies need their own drone air force flown by specialist soldiers , study says
message:
The air war in Ukraine has become a cat-and-mouse game where drones must constantly evolve.
RUSI envisions each drone battalion being equipped with everything needed to conduct a variety of UAV operations.
This would include "situational awareness UAVs optimized for tactical reconnaissance; tactical strike UAVs; ISR [reconnaissance] UAVs able to penetrate into operational depth; operational strike UAVs; and platform-launched effects designed specifically to synchronize with and enable other weapons systems."
To support friendly ground troops in contact with the enemy, flocks of expendable reconnaissance drones would operate up to 5 miles beyond the enemy front line.
"It therefore makes sense to concentrate UAV operation if UAVs are parts of a mass precision strike complex," the report concluded.
event_breakdown:
- The air war in Ukraine has become a cat-and-mouse game where drones must constantly evolve.
- RUSI envisions equipping each drone battalion with various UAVs for different operations.
- Flocks of expendable reconnaissance drones would support friendly ground troops up to 5 miles beyond the enemy front line.
- The report concluded that it makes sense to concentrate UAV operation within a mass precision strike complex.

title: Armies need their own drone air force flown by specialist soldiers , study says
message:
The air war in Ukraine has become a cat-and-mouse game where drones must constantly evolve.
RUSI envisions each drone battalion being equipped with everything needed to conduct a variety of UAV operations.
This would include "situational awareness UAVs optimized for tactical reconnaissance; tactical strike UAVs; ISR [reconnaissance] UAVs able to penetrate into operational depth; operational strike UAVs; and platform-launched effects designed specifically to synchronize with and enable other weapons systems."
To support friendly ground troops in contact with the enemy, flocks of expendable reconnaissance drones would operate up to 5 miles beyond the enemy front line.
"It therefore makes sense to concentrate UAV operation if UAVs are parts of a mass precision strike complex," the report concluded.
event_breakdown:
- The air war in Ukraine evolves into a cat-and-mouse game requiring constant drone evolution.
- RUSI envisions equipping each drone battalion with tools for various UAV operations, including tactical reconnaissance, strike capabilities, ISR, operational strikes, and platform-launched effects.
- Expendable reconnaissance drones to support ground troops up to 5 miles beyond the enemy front line.
- Concentration of UAV operations recommended if drones are part of a mass precision strike complex, according to the report.

title: Journalist , 2 others killed after vehicle hit with remote - controlled blast in Khuzdar
message:
Journalist, 2 others killed after vehicle hit with remote-controlled blast in KhuzdarRemote-controlled blast was carried out on the Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road on National HighwayMohammad Siddiq Mengal car is seen damaged following the blast on May 3, 2024, in this still taken from a video.
KHUZDAR: Mohammad Siddiq Mengal, a journalist and president of the Khuzdar Press Club, was killed along with two others on Friday after a remote-controlled bomb targeted his vehicle in Khuzdar, police told Geo News.
The killed passers-by were seriously injured in the remote-controlled blast and were brought to the hospital, while the other eight injured in the blast are undergoing treatment in different hospitals, police said.
According to the police, the remote-controlled blast was carried out on the Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road on the National Highway.
The station house officer said that the journalist's vehicle was the target of the blast and was hit when he was going to university from his home.
event_breakdown:
- Journalist and two others killed in remote-controlled blast targeting vehicle in Khuzdar.
- Remote-controlled blast occurs on Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road on National Highway.
- Mohammad Siddiq Mengal, journalist and president of Khuzdar Press Club, killed in blast while traveling from home to university.
- Passers-by seriously injured and brought to hospital; eight others injured undergoing treatment in different hospitals.

title: Eight Syrian soldiers injured in Israeli airstrike near Damascus
message:
Syrian defence ministry claimed on Friday that eight Syrian soldiers were injured in an Israeli airstrike near Damascus.
The Times of Israel citing Syrian state-run broadcaster said the strike caused "material losses."
Israeli warplanes launched their missiles from over the Golan Heights at a site in the area of the capital, the Syrian defence ministry said according to the Syrian Arab News Agency.
Also Russian state media TASS quoted Dubai-based Al Hadath TV as saying that the attack targeted a base of Lebanon's Shia militia, Hezbollah, located southwest of Damascus International Airport.
There was no official confirmation by Israeli authorities on the reported reprisal strike.
event_breakdown:
- Eight Syrian soldiers injured in Israeli airstrike near Damascus.
- Strike causes material losses, according to Syrian state-run broadcaster cited by The Times of Israel.
- Israeli warplanes launch missiles from over the Golan Heights at site near Damascus, according to Syrian defense ministry.
- Attack targets base of Lebanon's Shia militia, Hezbollah, southwest of Damascus International Airport, reported by Dubai-based Al Hadath TV quoted by Russian state media TASS.
- No official confirmation by Israeli authorities on reported reprisal strike.

title: Moment more than 100 of Putin troops  are wiped out  in long - range strike with newly supplied US ATACMS ballistic missile
message:
This is the moment more than 100 Russian troops are believed to have been killed in an ATACMS tactical ballistic missile strike on occupied Luhansk.
A military training ground was seen being hit by multiple explosions typical of an ATACMS strike in footage captured by a drone flying high above.
Footage of the recent attack appears to show the training ground as one such target.
Over the area where the Russian soldiers were seen seconds earlier, hundreds of flashes of smoke are seen erupting over the clearing.
These flashes, according to analysts, were the M74 APAM mini-bombs detonating on the training ground, killing many of the Russian troops gathered there.
event_breakdown:
- More than 100 Russian troops believed to have been killed in an ATACMS tactical ballistic missile strike on occupied Luhansk
- Military training ground hit by multiple explosions typical of an ATACMS strike
- Footage of recent attack shows the training ground as a target
- Hundreds of flashes of smoke seen erupting over the clearing where Russian soldiers were gathered
- M74 APAM mini-bombs detonating on the training ground, killing many Russian troops

title: N Korea plotting attacks on embassies , Seoul says
message:
N Korea plotting attacks on embassies, Seoul saysAFP, SEOULSouth Korea’s spy agency yesterday said that Pyongyang was plotting “terrorist” attacks targeting Seoul’s officials and citizens overseas, with the South Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs raising the alert level for diplomatic missions in five countries.
North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, right, visits the Pyongyang General Control Center at the State Directorate of Aerospace Technology in Pyongyang on Friday.
As a result, the North may be “plotting retaliation” against South Korean embassy staff on such pretenses, NIS added.
This marked the highest number of defections by North Korean elites to the South since 2017, Seoul said.
The consul, also an intelligence agent, had been monitoring Pyongyang’s illicit activities, including drug trafficking and the production of counterfeit banknotes, according to South Korean reports.
event_breakdown:
- South Korea's spy agency warns of North Korean plot for "terrorist" attacks targeting Seoul's officials and citizens overseas.
- South Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs raises alert level for diplomatic missions in five countries.
- North Korean leader Kim Jong-un visits Pyongyang General Control Center at State Directorate of Aerospace Technology.
- North Korea may be "plotting retaliation" against South Korean embassy staff.
- Highest number of defections by North Korean elites to South Korea since 2017 reported by Seoul.
- Consul, also an intelligence agent, monitors Pyongyang's illicit activities including drug trafficking and counterfeit banknote production.

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 03 May 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
Russian forces fired artillery and mortars at more than 10x settlements, including Makiivka, Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, Yampolivka (Donetsk oblast).
Russian forces launched air strikes in the vicinities of Verkhn'okam'yans'ke, Spirne, Ivano-Dar'ivka and New York (Donetsk oblast).
Russian forces launched air strikes in the vicinities of Vovche, Kalynove, Zhelanne, Vesele, Novoselivka Persha, Komyshivka, Karlivka (Donetsk oblast).
event_breakdown:
- Ukraine attacked by land, naval, and air forces of Russia, sparking largest European war since World War II.
- Russian forces fire artillery and mortars at over 10 settlements, including Makiivka, Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, Yampolivka (Donetsk oblast).
- Russian forces launch air strikes near Verkhn'okam'yans'ke, Spirne, Ivano-Dar'ivka, and New York (Donetsk oblast).
- Russian forces conduct air strikes near Vovche, Kalynove, Zhelanne, Vesele, Novoselivka Persha, Komyshivka, Karlivka (Donetsk oblast).

title: Military concludes airstrike in Syria last May killed civilian , not terrorist
message:
Almost a year later, the U.S. military has concluded that an airstrike last May in northwestern Syria killed a civilian, instead of a senior al Qaeda leader, as it initially claimed.
Though the investigation found several areas the command could improve on, according to the summary, it did not recommend any accountability actions for killing a civilian.
In a tweet on May 3, the same day as the strike, a group known as “The White Helmets” who work as first responders in Syria identified Masto as the civilian killed.
The White Helmets said Masto was grazing sheep when the strike killed him and several of the sheep.
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin issued a Civilian Harm Mitigation and Response Action Plan to limit civilian casualties in U.S. military operations after a series of media reports revealed operations in Syria, Iraq, and Afghanistan had killed more civilians than initially reported.
event_breakdown:
- U.S. military airstrike in northwestern Syria last May kills civilian instead of senior al Qaeda leader initially claimed.
- Investigation finds areas for improvement but does not recommend accountability actions for civilian death.
- "The White Helmets" identify civilian named Masto killed in airstrike while grazing sheep.
- Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin issues Civilian Harm Mitigation and Response Action Plan to limit civilian casualties in U.S. military operations following reports of higher civilian death tolls in Syria, Iraq, and Afghanistan.

title: Rafah offensive and war in Gaza : Threat of a dangerous escalation
message:
Rafah and RegionWithin the region, there is apprehension about the Rafah offensive.
In case of the Rafah offensive going ahead, there is all likelihood that the engagements from Hezbollah into northern Israel will grow.
ConclusionLike the Israeli strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus, the Rafah offensive too threatens to escalate the conflict if launched.
While the Iran-Israel spat was short, the Rafah offensive could spread very fast.
The only face-saving exit for either of the parties is an early and long lasting ceasefire in Gaza before any offensive in Rafah.
event_breakdown:
- Apprehension about Rafah offensive in the region
- Likelihood of Hezbollah engagements into northern Israel in case of Rafah offensive
- Threat of conflict escalation if Rafah offensive is launched
- Possibility of rapid spread of conflict with Rafah offensive
- Need for early and lasting ceasefire in Gaza to prevent Rafah offensive

title: Teenagers and terrorism : What is being done ?
message:
AdvertisementNor is the link yet clear between the six charged this week and the church attacker, though one described him as a “mate”.
They had comprised half of ASIO’s “priority counter-terrorism caseload” just a couple of years ago, and “it’s picked up again”, he said.
ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess told the press club that young terror suspects were not a new problem.
Muslim leaders have slammed authorities for not exploring alternatives to the counter-terrorism raids in Sydney last month.
The speed with which police designated the church stabbing a terrorist incident, just hours after it occurred, remains another source of grievance.
event_breakdown:
1. Six individuals were charged and are linked to a church attacker.
2. The six individuals were part of ASIO's priority counter-terrorism caseload in the past.
3. ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess stated that young terror suspects were not a new problem.
4. Muslim leaders criticized authorities for not considering alternatives to counter-terrorism raids in Sydney.
5. Police quickly labeled the church stabbing as a terrorist incident shortly after it occurred.

title: Ukraine wiped out 100 Russian troops at once in a strike showcasing the range and power of its new US ATACMS
message:
Ukrainian forces took out more than 100 Russian soldiers with an ATACMS missile, per OSINT analysts.
AdvertisementA Ukrainian ATACMS long-range missile strike killed more than 100 Russian soldiers in an occupied region 50 miles from the front line, according to OSINT and military analysts.
Osinttechnical said at least one of the missiles struck a gathering of more than 100 Russian soldiers, with hundreds of M74 APAM bomblets falling on them.
The US had previously sent ATACMS with a shorter range to Ukraine, but the versions sent recently can travel about 190 miles — which puts higher-value targets in Ukraine's crosshairs.
The US sent Ukraine ATACMS with a shorter range last fall, which enabled Ukraine to destroy Russian helicopters and airfields behind the front lines, but not go after more distant targets.
location: occupied region 50 miles from the front line
event_breakdown:
- Ukrainian forces conducted a long-range missile strike with ATACMS, killing more than 100 Russian soldiers in an occupied region 50 miles from the front line
- At least one of the missiles struck a gathering of more than 100 Russian soldiers, with hundreds of M74 APAM bomblets falling on them
- The US sent ATACMS with a shorter range to Ukraine last fall, enabling the destruction of Russian helicopters and airfields behind the front lines
- Recent versions of ATACMS sent by the US to Ukraine can travel about 190 miles, putting higher-value targets in Ukraine's crosshairs

title: Russia breached global chemical weapons ban in Ukraine war , US says - New Delhi Times - India Only International Newspaper
message:
The United States accused Russia on Wednesday of breaching a global chemical weapons ban by deploying the choking agent chloropicrin against Ukrainian troops.
The State Department also accused Russia of using riot control agents “as a method of warfare” in Ukraine.
Additionally, Russian forces have used grenades loaded with CS and CN gases, according to the Ukrainian military.
A guided bomb attack killed two civilians, including a 38-year-old woman and her father, Kharkiv regional Governor Oleh Syniehubov said.
Russia’s defense ministry said Wednesday that it thwarted Ukrainian drone attacks targeting several Russian regions.
event_breakdown:
- United States accuses Russia of deploying chloropicrin against Ukrainian troops
- United States accuses Russia of using riot control agents in Ukraine
- Russian forces use grenades loaded with CS and CN gases, according to Ukrainian military
- Guided bomb attack kills two civilians in Kharkiv region
- Russian defense ministry claims to have thwarted Ukrainian drone attacks targeting Russian regions

title: Three terrorists killed in Tank operation
message:
Security forces on Thursday killed three terrorists during a joint intelligence-based operation (IBO) in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa’s Tank district, the military said in a statement.
According to the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR), during the operation, following a fierce exchange of gunfire, security forces successfully neutralised three terrorists, including ringleaders Azmat alias Azmati, Karamat alias Hanzla, and terrorist Rehan.
The slain militants remained “actively involved” in several terrorist activities in the area, including the recent abduction of a district and sessions judge of South Waziristan district, the military’s media wing stated.
It further asserted that the security forces remain determined to eliminate the menace of terrorism from the country.
Read more: At least four terrorists killed in Tank IBOHe returned home safely, the Counter-Terrorism Department (CTD) confirmed on Monday.
event_breakdown:
- Security forces killed three terrorists in an operation in Tank district, Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa
- The slain militants were involved in terrorist activities including the recent abduction of a judge in South Waziristan district
- Security forces asserted their determination to eliminate terrorism from the country
- At least four terrorists were killed in the Tank IBO
- A person returned home safely, confirmed by the Counter-Terrorism Department

title: Surprise : Literal Terrorist Visits Pro - Terrorism  Encampment  at Major University in Chicago
message:
When I call Ayers and Dohrn 'terrorists,' I mean it quite literally.
Mr. Ayers, who is 56, calls it a memoir, somewhat coyly perhaps, since he also says some of it is fiction.
In his book Mr. Ayers describes the Weathermen descending into a ''whirlpool of violence.''
Between 1970 and 1974 the Weathermen took responsibility for 12 bombings, Mr. Ayers writes...
Advertisementbill ayers of the weather underground addresses students at the uchicago popular university for gaza ‼️‼️ pic.twitter.com/V7MSsS4Q8V — kxh (@halfmoonpoem) April 29, 2024A literal, unrepentant, anti-American terrorist bomber addressing a pro-terrorism crowd.
event_breakdown:
- Bill Ayers and Bernardine Dohrn are referred to as terrorists
- Bill Ayers calls his book a memoir with some elements of fiction
- The Weathermen group is described as descending into violence in the book
- Weathermen took responsibility for 12 bombings between 1970 and 1974
- Bill Ayers speaks at the University of Chicago Popular University event for Gaza

title: For Decades , Moscow Has Sought to Silence Its Critics Abroad
message:
Security expert Andrei Soldatov said the work of the Kremlin's intelligence services, then and now, has been defined by threats from dissidents abroad.
That's how it caught Sidney Reilly, a Ukrainian-born agent who worked for Britain both inside Russia and abroad.
He was befriended there by Ramon Mercader, who pretended to be sympathetic to Trotsky's ideas but in reality was a Soviet agent.
While living in exile in Munich in 1959, Bandera, 50, was killed after being confronted by a Soviet agent with a gun that sprayed cyanide.
Britain accused Russia in the attack, which the Kremlin denied being behind, and Western nations expelled Russian spies in response.
event_breakdown:
1. Sidney Reilly, a Ukrainian-born agent working for Britain, was caught by the Kremlin's intelligence services.
2. Ramon Mercader, a Soviet agent, befriended Sidney Reilly under the guise of being sympathetic to Trotsky's ideas.
3. Stepan Bandera, living in exile in Munich, was killed by a Soviet agent using cyanide.
4. Britain accused Russia of the attack on Stepan Bandera, which the Kremlin denied, leading to the expulsion of Russian spies by Western nations.

title: Iranian - Made Cruise Missile Crashes in Somalia , No Casualties Reported
message:
TALEEX, Somalia (Horseed Media) – An apparent Iranian-made cruise missile crashed in Somalia’s Sool region late Thursday night, according to witness accounts and visual evidence from the scene, though no casualties have been reported.
Debris an apparent Iranian-made cruise missile crashed in Somalia’s SoolResidents of Taleex district described hearing a loud explosion around midnight, with wreckage discovered in the morning bearing resemblance to an Iranian Quds land-attack cruise missile (LACM).
No group has claimed responsibility for the apparent cruise missile launch violating Somali airspace.
“These actions are taken to protect freedom of navigation and make international waters safer and more secure for US, coalition, and merchant vessels,” CENTCOM said in a statement.
No casualties have been reported in Somalia from the apparent failed cruise missile strike.
event_breakdown:
1. An apparent Iranian-made cruise missile crashed in Somalia’s Sool region late Thursday night, as reported by witness accounts and visual evidence from the scene.
2. Residents of Taleex district heard a loud explosion around midnight, with wreckage discovered in the morning resembling an Iranian Quds land-attack cruise missile (LACM).
3. No group claimed responsibility for the apparent cruise missile launch that violated Somali airspace.
4. CENTCOM stated that such actions were taken to protect freedom of navigation and enhance the safety of international waters for US, coalition, and merchant vessels.
5. No casualties have been reported in Somalia as a result of the apparent failed cruise missile strike.

title: Alleged Israeli Airstrike Injures Eight Syrian Soldiers Near Damascus
message:
Eight Syrian soldiers were injured in an alleged Israeli airstrike on the outskirts of Damascus, according to Syrian state media reports.
The strike, which occurred shortly before 11 p.m., targeted a military position in the Damascus area, as confirmed by the Syrian Defense Ministry.
Syria's state-run SANA broadcaster cited a military source reporting that Israeli warplanes launched missiles from over the Golan Heights in northern Israel, resulting in material losses.
The targeted building, located just south of the Sayyeda Zeinab shrine, was allegedly used by Syrian security forces, according to a security source in the alliance backing Syrian President Bashar Assad’s government.
This strike marks a development since the April 1 incident, where several top Islamic Republic Revolutionary Guard Corps officers were killed in a strike also attributed to Israel.
event_breakdown:
- Eight Syrian soldiers injured in alleged Israeli airstrike on outskirts of Damascus.
- Strike targets military position in Damascus area, confirmed by Syrian Defense Ministry.
- Israeli warplanes launch missiles from over Golan Heights, northern Israel, resulting in material losses.
- Targeted building, near Sayyeda Zeinab shrine, allegedly used by Syrian security forces.
- Strike follows April 1 incident where top Islamic Republic Revolutionary Guard Corps officers were killed in a strike attributed to Israel.

title: When Tony Blair Bombed Montenegro
message:
It came amid airstrikes on Yugoslav forces in Kosovo, where Bill Clinton and Tony Blair waged a “humanitarian intervention” ostensibly to save ethnic Albanians from Serb leader Slobodan Milosevic.
Such secrecy would become a common feature of future NATO air wars, making it hard for victims to hold individual states responsible.
Blair’s ally in the conflict, Kosovo Liberation Army (KLA) leader Hashem Thaci, is currently on trial for war crimes.
During the air war, Sawers pushed for Britain to deepen ties with the KLA, who were fighting Serb forces on the ground.
a decade on from the Kosovo war.
event_breakdown:
- Airstrikes on Yugoslav forces in Kosovo during a "humanitarian intervention" led by Bill Clinton and Tony Blair.
- NATO air wars characterized by secrecy, making it difficult to hold individual states accountable.
- Kosovo Liberation Army (KLA) leader Hashem Thaci on trial for war crimes.
- Britain urged to deepen ties with KLA during conflict against Serb forces in Kosovo.
- Reflection a decade after the Kosovo war.

title: Russian missile attack injures 14 in Odesa - New Delhi Times - India Only International Newspaper - Empowering Global Vision , Empathizing with India
message:
Ukrainian officials said a Russian missile attack injured 14 people Thursday at a postal facility in the southern city of Odesa.
Oleh Kiper, the regional governor of Odesa, said the latest attack was another crime committed by Russia against Ukrainian civilians.
In Smolensk, the regional governor, Vaisly Anokhin, said the Ukrainian drones tried to attack an energy facility.
Roman Staravoit, the governor in the Kursk region, said Russian forces downed a Ukrainian drone there, but that there was also damage to power lines.
Additionally, Russian forces have used grenades loaded with CS and CN tear gasses, according to the Ukrainian military.
event_breakdown:
- Russian missile attack in postal facility in Odesa, injuring 14 people
- Ukrainian drones attempted to attack an energy facility in Smolensk
- Russian forces downed Ukrainian drone in Kursk region, leading to damage to power lines
- Russian forces used grenades loaded with CS and CN tear gases according to Ukrainian military

title: Haunted by their colleague deaths : The journalists risking their lives to report from Gaza
message:
Gazan journalists told CNN they are haunted by their colleagues’ deaths, as they balance the emotional labor of covering the war with trying to protect their families.
Israel launched a military assault on Gaza on October 7 after the militant group Hamas, which governs Gaza, killed at least 1,200 people in Israel and abducted more than 250 others.
After nearly seven months of war, Abu Dagga told CNN that she, too, wants to leave.
The photojournalist for Turkish state broadcaster TRT told CNN he had been traveling through the neighborhood, after being displaced from the local refugee camp.
“This was a huge burden on me,” Dahman, 36, told CNN last month.

title: Gaza : 54 Palestinians killed , 102 injured by Israeli bombardments last 48hrs - The Muslim News
message:
Gaza City, (Al Jazeera, Wafa, AA): Between the afternoons of 1 and 3 May, according to the Ministry of Health (MoH) in Gaza, 54 Palestinians were killed and 102 others injured by indiscriminate bombings by Israeli Defence Forces in Gaza Strip.
Israel’s attacks have so far directly caused $33 billion of damage in the Gaza Strip, it said.
Meanwhile, nine more civilians were injured in another Israeli strike on the Bureij refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip.
Meanwhile, nine more civilians were injured in another Israeli strike on the Bureij refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip.
[Photo: Children in Rafah city queue to receive a bowl of food for their families from charity organizations, in Rafah, Gaza on 03 05 2024.
event_breakdown:
- Indiscriminate bombings by Israeli Defense Forces in Gaza City result in 54 Palestinians killed and 102 others injured, according to the Ministry of Health in Gaza.
- Israeli attacks cause $33 billion of damage in the Gaza Strip.
- Nine civilians injured in Israeli strike on Bureij refugee camp in central Gaza Strip.

title: Russia Says It Killed Ukrainian Agent Plotting  Terrorist  Acts : Report
message:
The man was planning to attack a fuel depot in the Leningrad region.
(Representational)Russia's FSB security service said on Friday it had killed a man recruited by Ukraine to blow up military buildings and energy sites in Russia, state media reported.
The FSB said on Friday it had "neutralised" a man who had "planned to commit a series of terrorist acts in Russia", Russian state-run news agencies quoted an FSB statement as saying.
These, it said, included attacks "against defence ministry facilities in the Moscow region and against members of a volunteer battalion and a volunteer centre in Saint Petersburg".
The man was planning to attack a fuel depot in the Leningrad region, the FSB alleged.
event_breakdown: null

message:

Still, the US did not launch an official investigation of the strike until nearly 8 weeks later after the strike that killed him.
Mohammad Mesto sits next to the grave of his brother Lutfi, who was killed on May 3 in a suspected US military strike in northern Syria.
In that case, CENTCOM opened a formal 15-6 investigation into the strike within a week of the operation.
Mesto’s family previously told CNN that he had been out grazing his sheep when he was killed.

- CENTCOM opened a formal 15-6 investigation into the strike within a week of the operation

title: Russian missiles hit Ukraine Odesa for third time in a week , injuring 14
message:
Russia struck the southern Ukrainian port city of Odesa with ballistic missiles in a nighttime attack, injuring 14 people and starting a massive blaze, local officials and emergency services said.
The third attack on the city in a week hit a sorting depot belonging to Ukraine's biggest private delivery company, Nova Poshta.
Ukraine has deployed increasingly sophisticated long-range drones to hit back, aiming at targets on Russian soil, especially infrastructure that sustains the Russian economy and war effort.
The governors of three Russian regions reported that energy facilities were damaged by Ukrainian drone strikes overnight.
The Russian Defense Ministry said Ukrainian drones were shot down over the Bryansk, Krasnodar, Rostov and Belgorod regions.
event_breakdown:
- Russia strikes southern Ukrainian port city of Odesa with ballistic missiles, injuring 14 people and causing a massive blaze.
- Third attack on Odesa in a week targets sorting depot belonging to Ukraine's largest private delivery company, Nova Poshta.
- Ukraine deploys increasingly sophisticated long-range drones to target infrastructure on Russian soil, impacting Russian economy and war effort.
- Governors of three Russian regions report damage to energy facilities from Ukrainian drone strikes overnight.
- Russian Defense Ministry confirms Ukrainian drones shot down over Bryansk, Krasnodar, Rostov, and Belgorod regions.

title: Eight Syrian soldiers injured in Israeli airstrike - News Today
message:
Syrian defense ministry claimed on Friday that eight Syrian soldiers were injured in an Israeli airstrike near Damascus.
The Times of Israel citing a Syrian state-run broadcaster said the strike caused “material losses.”Israeli warplanes launched their missiles from over the Golan Heights at a site in the area of the capital, the Syrian defense ministry said according to the Syrian Arab News Agency.
Following this development, US media reported that Israel had carried out overnight airstrikes against Israel after which Iran fired air defense batteries and shut down flight operations in several cities including Tehran, Shiraz and Isfahan that was later lifted.
There was no official confirmation by Israeli authorities on the reported reprisal strike.
Meanwhile, The US Department of Defence said that a drone strike in the year 2023 in Syria, initially said to have successfully targeted an al-Qaeda leader, actually killed a farmer, Washington Post reported from the summary of an internal investigation done by the Pentagon released on Thursday (US local time).
event_breakdown:
- Israeli airstrike near Damascus: Eight Syrian soldiers injured, material losses reported
- US media reports Israel carried out overnight airstrikes against Syria
- Iran fires air defense batteries and shuts down flight operations in several cities including Tehran, Shiraz, and Isfahan
- Lack of official confirmation by Israeli authorities on reprisal strike
- Drone strike in Syria in 2023 mistakenly kills a farmer instead of al-Qaeda leader
